result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaac D Van Asten was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Allowed to serve on home monitor if he qualifies.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence he would be serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Comply with anger management. 
Comply with any other assessments or counseling as recommended by the agent. 
Comply with all conditions of any other probation that he is currently under.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaac D Van Asten

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Isaac D Van Asten in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:00 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant and defendant concur with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Atty McFarland makes statements re: facts. 
Court questions Atty McFarland re: repeater. 
Atty McFarland agrees with repeater status. 
Defendant acknowledges prior convictions. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).  
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1 as violent/threatening and as Domestic incident and as repeater.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Serve 30 days jail - STAYED
1 day credit.
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Consecutive to any other sentence he would be serving. 
Allowed to serve on home monitor if he qualifies. 
Placed on probation for a period of 12 months:
Comply with anger management.
Comply with any other assessments or counseling as recommended by the agent. 
Comply with all conditions of any other probation that he is currently under.

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Jessica Gagas unless the victim goes to CAP Services to get a Family Safety Plan and then files the form with the Clerk of Courts and District Attorney.  If filed, then no abusive contact with the above named.

Defendant Isaac D Van Asten in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Knaapen asks that the warrant be vacated. State is willing to reinstate the signature bond.  A pea/sentencing has been scheduled. 

BY THE COURT:  Warrant is quashed and the bond is reinstated.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Erik John Mcfarland in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:45 p.m.  Court recalls the case.  
Matter was set for 8:30 but notice was sent for 1:30.   

Atty McFarland has not been able to reach his client. 
Atty Cousins requests a bench warrant.  Is on supervision and spoke to his agent in February and he was doing well at that time. 

BY THE COURT: 
Court notes it is 1:47 p.m.  The defendant has failed to appear.  Notice had been sent to the defendant.  Bench warrant authorized.

Attorney Erik John Mcfarland in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:58 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

State requests matter to be rescheduled.
Parties were of the understanding that this was to be scheduled at 1:30 PM.

BY THE COURT:
Case will be re-called at 1:30 PM.
Pre-trial conference on April 27, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Isaac D Van Asten in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
P/NG entered.
Bond Continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 10:30 am.
CAP Services: Personalized Family Safety Plan filed by Jessica Gagas - wants contact

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Jessica Gagas unless the victim goes to CAP Services to get a Family Safety Plan and then files the form with the Clerk of Courts and District Attorney.  If filed, then no abusive contact with the above named.

Clerk is Shelley P.
DA #15PT201
11:12 a.m.  Court calls case.

ADA Cousins  appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins  states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a signature bond of $500.00 with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  Feburary 16, 2015  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2.
